qas.question: The English Dominican Order focused primarily on what?
What did the English Order not care about?
The English Dominican Order wanted to put what at the center of their study of Christ?
What does Christ's love reveal to humanity?
What does love lead to according to English mystics?
What did the French Dominican order focus primarily on?
What did the English Dominican Order expect and seek the appearance of?

plausible_answers.text: that environment that allowed Jesus to fulfill His divine mission

qas.question: What did the English Dominican Order not want to create in themselves?
What did the French Dominican Order want to put at the the center of their study of Christ?
What does love lead to according to French mystics?

context: The English concentrated on the spirit of <a0_0><b5_0>the events of Christ's life<b5_0/><a0_0/>, not the literality of events. They neither expected nor sought the appearance of <a1_0><b6_0>the stigmata<b6_0/><a1_0/> or any other physical manifestation. They wanted to create in themselves <b7_0>that environment that allowed Jesus to fulfill His divine mission<b7_0/>, insofar as they were able. At the center of this environment was <a2_0>love<a2_0/>: the love that Christ showed for humanity in becoming human. Christ's love reveals <a3_0>the mercy of God<a3_0/> and His care for His creation. English Dominican mystics sought through this <b8_0>love<b8_0/> to become images of God. Love led to <a4_0><b9_0>spiritual growth<b9_0/><a4_0/> that, in turn, reflected an increase in love for God and humanity. This increase in universal love allowed men's wills to conform to God's will, just as Christ's will submitted to the Father's will.
